values:
<lj-cut text="ramblings. ramblerambleramble">i had my first revelatory introspective discovery in years tonight. i'll break this down for the two of you that may or may not even see this. this week i received a friend request from one elizabeth jane jackson, liz to some, jane to 50% of people who'll read this. anyway, this was the girl for whom my first band was named, and receiving that request took me back to that summer when we met and, i'll be honest, i totally fell in love with her, and the events of the following summer that took her out of my life forever basically. thinking about this while driving home from first fridays tonight, an event i attended regularly with a different former lover, took me on an unexpected detour.

listening to kid a, which i haven't listened to in ages, i decided i was going to creepily drive by the houses of my girlfriends of yesteryear. naturally i decided to do this chronologically, starting with deena gunnell, proceeding to ali hansen, and ending with elizabeth koebele. as i drove past each house, each long since vacated by those that made those drives worth it, old emtions i really haven't felt in years really swelled over me. the pain of the breakups having long since vanished, all that i remembered were the positive feelings and good memories i had in these edifices that once housed individuals that in one way or another changed me and my life.

that's neat, right? this kind of experience typically should have brought nice, warm fuzzies that ended in a melancholy and longing for my past of impossible happiness that somehow existed in some fold in the fabric of space/time. but not this time.

of late, when ever i feel particularly introspective, i rarely come across any thought i haven't thought before. which, obviously, for an introvert has an excruciating harshness that would drive a man insane. but tonight, for the first time in years, i thought of something different, a stream of consciousness that took me some place i never knew existed in this underworked mind.

i realized these emotions i was feeling for these former lovers were that i loved them and they loved me..in spite of myself. this was something i feel was rare growing up, or maybe was just too impersonal for me to feel like it was real. anyway, the point is they were able to give me something that was unlike anything i could get anywhere else, and liz jackson was the first that i had ever received that from. she was also the first female in my life that my parents went to lengths to keep away from me..and were extremely successful in that venture.

there's a whole backstory i'm not going to go into, but the bottom line is this, she lived in utah and only visited during the summer, and my parents made sure she stayed in utah for the summer...forever. i hated them for that. for keeping me away from a happiness i never felt around them from a love that i never received from them. it seemed to me to be this destructive mentality, "since we can't be the ones to give that to you, we'll be the ones to make sure you never have that in your life." and that seemed the cycle whenever i dated anyone after that. they would do their best to try and be disruptive to that relationship as they could..and i would do my best to not let them...but it always was a source of serious contention that my significant other couldn't really feel like they were welcome in my home and ultimately led to the eventual termination of all three major relationships.

anyway, as i pulled into my driveway at the conclusion of idioteque, i realized this is why i now lack the ability to find or date anyone..my parents are now pushing me to do it. it's no longer an act against them and it just can never hold for me what it used to...</lj-cut>

i just realized tonight, after yet another viewing of frost/nixon(which should have won best picture 2008) why the film slumdog millionaire has no relevence in life(mine anyway) and didn't deserve the the academy awards it received. those of course being best picture and best screenplay.

i don't believe in karma. i believe someone who is intrinsically good can be shat on their whole life and never tip some cosmic scale that will suddenly rain down good fortune. i also feel the opposite to be true, that someone innately evil can be smiled on by the fates and have the world handed to them on a platter with no negative, reprecussive explosion waiting around the next turn. i feel to think otherwise is absurd.

i believe in cause and effect. that for every action there is an equal and opposite reaction. i believe that even if you do paint God into the picture that he will still be bound by the same governing universal laws, he also will be bound by cause and effect. what's going to stop a random stranger from clubbing me over the head tomorrow, kidnapping me, and slowly torturing me until i drip my last drop of blood, aside from his own personal decision not to do so? it's not like God is going to physically stop him because, "oh, he just got done recovering from 2 different accidents. oh, his love life is completely worthless and nonexistent right now. oh, his job sucks. oh, his living situation is nearly uninhabitable. i've screwed with his life enough. let's not let gaear grimsrud screw him over today. short circuit his wood chipper too while you're at it." (i'm trying not to interject personal religious beliefs on this issue)

i suppose my point is that slumdog is too capricious a story based too heavily on the childlike belief that because because jamal malik had been shat on his whole life that he would haply be put in the exact circumstance that he would need to be in to become a millionaire and live happily ever after with the girl of his dreams because life is always fair. it's too fantastical a fairy tale to be taken as seriously as the world has taken it. i was waiting for him and latika to fly off into the sunset on falcor as they rolled credits.

i don't know what i'm saying any more...i'm tired. i just know that this is quite possibly the most critically overrated film of all time. 

end of line.

it's an extremely rare occurance that i remember my dreams...but i cannot remember the last time i had repeated dreams about something i wanted this fiercely only to wake every morning to the reality that it can never be mine.
few things suck as much as being a day out of surgery and still being in massive amounts of pain and being unable to to ingest any form of pain relief without inducing massive amounts of vomiting...

well here it finally goes in some sort of fashion. tonight was the first night in a very long time that i actually felt like writing my own music, instead of just writing parts to someone else's music. it is a feeling i haven't felt, at least to this degree in i'd say over 5 years. i think what it comes down to is the fact that i haven't felt like i've adequate...well inspiration for lack of a better word. i mean my love life has dragged me through one of the shittiest holes i've ever been through in my life as of late...but to me love is something too numinous to tarnish by trying to put word and verse to properly. however i knew that with where i had been lately, i wouldn't even try to write something not pertaining to this subject...but i suppose the events of friday night pretty much diverted my attention from the forlorn state i so readily and consistently found myself in...

friday night i lost a very big chunk of the fingertip of my left middle finger...a finger very necessary for guitar playing...i don't know if i will be able to play the anymore...

wow typing with one good hand takes a lot longer than i thought it would...only 50 more minutes until my next painkiller...

anyway, if you want details, please be considerate and call. kind of painful to do this much typing but at least i got to vent a little bit...

so i signed into my livejournal hoping that everyone on my friends page would be completely dormant and i would have this dead community to post some very personal happenings in my life mainly as an outlet more than a need for attention...that was my hope anyway. but lo and behold upon signing in, there is this remnant of a populace still stalwart and standing and updating regularly. to you i say well done. but still i am left unvented...
i'll see ya'll in 170 days. later and later

Happy birthday to this girl:



from this guy:



later mesa.

Dear livejournal community, I've known all of you for the past few years of my life and longer. i must say that i haven't seen many of you in quite some time, but i appreciate what each of you has done to make me the person that i am. i depart from you all now, for but a short 24 month period of time. i wish you all the best, and if you get bored you should write me: In the MTC: Elder Steven J. Packer Washington Everett Mission Provo MTC Bldg. 1-M Rm. A106 Provo, UT 84604 Mission Home (Letters only): Elder Steven J. Packer Washington Everett Mission P.O. Box 13390 Mill Creek, WA 98082-1390 if you get bored, and want to send me packages, you need another address. talk to this girl: later and later

i speak tomorrow at nine in the am. if you wanna come give me a call. or just go to the building on gilbert and brown at nine and i will be there. i'd love to see you there.

later and later

so i had some really interesting thoughts tonight. i thought i should write a livejournal entry about it....but none of you read my livejournal anymore because i never post. and i don't really post because you never read....besides i prefer personal conversation and the commitment that is implied when someone devotes enough empathy to trying to understand the concepts that trouble or set your mind free. i guess that's why i like liz so much.
mine: byebye
if you people have the time, you should come see us play. i would love to see you there. and i know you'll need this: http://www.mapquest.com/ later later
today is my last day at bahama bucks

long day. felt like it should be saturday. went to phoenix. angel got a guitar. hung with angel and liana. got some nielson's. played softball. won. got kaylynn. ate food. watched the rest of chocolat. enjoyed that portion of my evening. i find witnessing arguments...uncomfortable. my parents are gone for the night. you are all asleep or doing something else. i have nothing to do. goodnight.

ps. people need to communicate their true thoughts to the people to which they need to be communicated.

bye

sorry ty ty, i couldn't wait anymore. i got my ticket today....it's in theatre 13...not 12.....hopefully someone will trade, otherwise we'll be standing alone for a long time....but i'm soooo down.....i like how my star wars ticket gets its own update. that's a tech right?

so i went to prom last night. i thoroughly enjoyed my date and my group. fantastic evening.


ps. star wars is gonna be effing amazing. i just checked the new video they have out and man it's gonna be phasing.....i guess i can't wait.

slater

so i finally have the computer back.....did you even notice i was gone?

later

....so that's kinda confusing....

so happy pi day everyone. two years ago today, i met a large majority of you at a show in britney gearhart's backyard. most of you have influenced my life in one way or another, and for that i thank you. a lot of you i still hang out with, and to those that i no longer hang with....what's the deal yo?? call me or something, let's hang or something.

angel has recently informed me that he needs to lose weight. he now skates, plays b-ball, and runs in the morning to shed that spare tire he has accumulated in his left buttcheek.....so says angel martinez.....what a crazy puerto rican.

i need a hair cut.....no you need them all cut dumbass!!


later

so i'm not sleeping tonight. i'm supposed to be writing up a lot of note cards for an english essay. i have to have 50 of them by tomorrow and instead of doing that all night, i decided to play knights of the old republic all night and then i was thinking i should start working on them if i want to turn them in and not lose 100 of the 1350 points that this essay is worth....but then i realized that my parents are out of town....i don't think i'm going to school tomorrow. but you know i think i'll do them anyway....and maybe i'll just turn them in tomorrow instead of going to school.

anyway, thanks to everyone of you that came to the show saturday night even though it was rainy out. you are all my hardest. i felt the love. drew danburry was a tech right? i think he might have been a bit faded......i need a roadie/tech

visited a little emo boy with a compound fracture today. he was all drugged out and playing with the pins in his leg, he is just the cutest thing ever. i forgot how much i dislike hospitals....

if you feel like being a tech, come visit me at work tomorrow from 1 - 4:30. i'm sure i'll be out of it, with my 5 hours of sleep in the last two days. just be hard laterlater.

i feel very cryptic as of late. i want every single person who reads this to ask me something about my life to illuminate my past, clarify my present, or elucidate my future and i will do my best to satisfy your inquiry through means i find necessary and proper.

and you happen to be reading this and start to think,"my goodness, i haven't hung out with this kid since the last time he updated his journal", then we need to hang very soon. call me up already. i'm usually a bored person, i usually have to entertain myself.....ohhh crusty.

i ran out of stuff to write. my mental processes are fried...i'm not going to be able to finish those cards afterall....

be hard.

later later

it's been a monthish....time for an update....i'm tired and i don't really want to, so i won't right now.

i was supposed to post some amazing quote from moroni in here....but i don't remember what it was....all well. just know that it was amazing.

bye bye
steven j. packer

and this is my update. don't expect much. moroni didn't call me back again...all well.

angel doesn't answer his phone ali has plans and liz doesn't get off work until 9. hey all you kids that know me....call me or something i guess...

bands are stressful.

school is hard to stay awake in.

i spend too much time on myspace.

my hair is annoying to take care of.

making guitars is more work than it's worth.

work is stressful i want to quit quite badly.

my parent's still have no idea i'm in two bands....and i think i need to tell them because i have a show on monday the 31st with the band they don't know exists....and we play really really late...on a school nite....but hey if we get 30 people out we make money....but we play at 11 so i don't think people will come...

i'm tired.

bye bye

so yeah, you all should attend it should be quite good and you get a free cd if i'm not mistaken. ps. hi, my name is steven j. packer. i update sporadically and never with anything of relevence to my recent life. pps. i got a phone. comment with your number if you wish to be added to my phone book. ppps. i'll only add you if you go to the show. pppps. be hard. later.

so i just finished making my personality scrapbook for psychology. as i was going through all the personality assessments, i was shocked to find out so much about myself that when i actually thought about it, it was really true. it also made me realize how much i owe people for helping me become who i am. even if at times i am discontent with myself, because of certain people, i am much more happy much more often.

thank you.


bye bye

i decided to be trendy:

4
You are sensitive and intuitive, with others and yourself. You are creative and dreamy... plus dramatic and unpredictable. You're emotionally honest, real, and easily hurt. Totally expressive, others always know exactly how you feel.
What number are you?

oh man. she looks so good. you guys have no idea!

bye bye

so my day was pretty ok i guess. what was worthy of an update, however, was miss ali hansen's new hair cut. sooooo amazingly hott!! i knew it would be, so i prepared myself ahead of time to be blown away. even still i barely managed to control myself. sooooo HOTT! yes soo hott it gets two t's.

anyway, recording for tdc tomorrow after work. work friday nite. work saturday afternoon which makes me miss a family thanksgiving thing. we're having it early so as not to conflict with other stuff on the other side of the fam....but yeah i'm gonna miss it. and i won't even get the luxury of no family home....grr. anyway, yeah, i'm not content with my line of work.

bye bye

dear everyone:

sorry i'm an asshole.

bye

so this weekend was pretty good. friday was awake & alert/before braille/wonderful wednesday show. not that many people went, so it was awesome. went with ali. had sooooo much fun. then saturday i went to INTERPOL/secret machines which was AMAZING! i knew interpol was amazing....but they're sooo much better live! also went with ali. 

i'm so happy that i got to hang out with ali this weekend. i never get to see her anymore, what with the boyfriend and stud co. and yearbook, and me with practice and work. we never get to hang out anymore, so i thorougly enjoyed my weekend with her. it was awesome!

angel was loose last nite.

bye bye
sometimes i really wish i had someone to take a nap with.

hi. i should update since i haven't for like 3 weeks, but i find i have nothing to say that might even remotley interest you, so no update of what is currently taking place in my life.

i hate being an afterthought...

bye bye

thanks everyone for yesterday and all your happy birthdays. i appreciated it.

anyway, today right after school i've been sooo busy. psych project and an essay. then mutual. then i'm missing circuitry practice so i can finish my essay that's due tomorrow. tomorrow after school is draft catharsis practice and saturday i practice w/ steven and tachi...hopefully practices happen this much a lot! i think i shall like it.

anyway, this weekend ali and i are supposed to hang out at least once if she's up for it. ummmm, that will be fantastically wonderful. anyway, i'm out.

bye bye

hello everyone. i steven j. packer am once again in control of my journal. i must say that my weekend was far superior to all of yours. sleeping and talking were definately the hightlight. trading clothes was also quite amazing! anyway, ali hansen rocks my socks!

bye bye

so i got to stay home tonight thanks to the lovely dictations of my dearest mother whom i find that i agree with on every issue on every subject.

goodbye ryan bingham. too bad we never got the chance to work it out.

bye bye

ps. guess what i did instead. sat on the computer all night while they watched tv....i can see the reason in me not being able to go.
well that'll probably cost about $300. at least i was able to shave and extra $100 off of it.

everyone apparently has seen the flyer. even the queen of england...or perhaps the hounds of hell? who knows. but i'm sure you've seen it, so you should go. even though i'll definately blow. shane angel and liz will do fantastic and i'll trip on a cord and pull my head off my cab and smash it all on the ground, then i'll top it all off and beat my cab with my guitar until everything is broken....

anyway, go to the show.

and i'm quite happy that you're going now!!!

anyway, school is already feeling really stale. someone make me do something quite different tomorrow. or just kick me in the shin really hard so i have a bruise to replace my indifference.

by the way, i think too much. do you think i think to much? i think i think to much. i even think that you think that i think too much....and so on.

i am going to assasinate you!

i work tonite.

bye bye

so i can finally speak now. so today was really lame starting off. i was woken up a 30 minutes early. my mom's like ohh, i'm sorry, i'll make you waffles. so i'm at least a little cheered up by that but then i start eating it and it's all grainy and like completely falls apart on my fork and i was all depressed. then i had to go to school. it was ok...apparently i'm enrolled in a remedial english class? whateva! any way went to sonic with kids and then ali showed up...MY GOD PEOPLE IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE HAIR YET YOU ARE DEFINATELY MISSING OUT....I AM COMPLETELY AWE STRUCK....WOW! so anyway i was all nervous because hey hair was so hott...anyway moving on from the completely beautiful hair. so then i went to work and that was lame, but ok i guess....i was really tired and someone's hair cut was on my mind....ok for real i'm done.

bye bye

how's it goin everyone. i was really happy i got to see ali hansen yesterday. i don't get to see her very often anymore. she's always so busy. but that's understandable with studco. and yb and everything else. but anyway, shopping was probably the highlight of my week this week so far. that was awesome. then the whole gather of people was good. martin would let me take him into manhood....all well.

bye bye

someone take me away. i'm sick of it all day in and day out. just take me away i don't even care where. just as long as it's not here. i've got $5 to keep me alive for however long were gone...and i can go a long time without eating. i'm just tired of not feeling...or maybe i'm tired of feeling only the same thing? i don't know, whatever it is, it's quite stale....

bye bye
apparently my character flaw is i don't think about myself enough....is that a character flaw??

i think to much.

yesterday i bowled a 151, my best in a while.

happy birthday yesterday andrew. the 151 was for u dude. tell me when u wanna go to the lake.

ummm, i'm boring.

the end.

WHERE THE FUCK DID ALI HANSEN GO?!!?!?
COME BACK HEY DIGITAL, COME BACK PINK BLAZER!!!

so as i contemplated what to write today and really what i felt about everything, the only thing i could come up with that really says it all is thank you. i never regret one minute.

love,
steven j. packer
thank you moroni for the icon!
